============================================================
Question: What are the recommended veterinary treatments if a cat ingests Peony? List them in order of priority (most urgent first). For each treatment provide: 1. Treatment name. 2. Brief description of the procedure. 3. Any situation-specific notes. Cite your sources.
============================================================

Based on the provided sources, peonies are identified as a common flower that can be harmful to cats if eaten1. However, the sources do not contain the specific veterinary treatments, procedures, or situation-specific notes for peony ingestion.
For general plant poisoning, the sources do recommend the following immediate first-aid and veterinary steps23:
1. Remove the Hazard and Contact the Vet: Immediately take the cat away from the plant and call your veterinarian for advice. Do not wait for severe symptoms to develop.
2. Do Not Induce Vomiting: Do not attempt to make your cat sick at home unless explicitly instructed to do so by a professional, as it may not be helpful and can sometimes cause further harm.
3. Collect Samples: If possible, take a sample of the plant—and a sample of the cat's vomit, if they have thrown up—to the veterinary clinic to help with the diagnosis.
